README.md

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 # QuEST
00002 
00003 A library for simulating operations on sets of qubits. 
00004 
00005 Example operations implemented:
00006 * Rotations of a single qubit
00007 * Measure if a single qubit is in the zero or one state
00008 * Two qubit phase gate
00009 
00010 ## Getting started
00011 
00012 With git: clone the root directory to your device
00013 
00014 git clone https://github.com/aniabrown/QuEST.git [QuESTHOME]
00015 
00016 Without git: download the directory manually
00017 
00018 'Clone or download' > 'Download zip'
00019 
00020 In the root directory, run a simple 8 qubit example on one node:
00021 
00022 Copy the make file and circuit code to your root directory:
00023 ```
00024 cp examples/basicTemplate.c .
00025 cp examples/makefile .
00026 ```
00027 
00028 The default compiler is the gnu compiler. To change to the intel compiler, edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile in the root directory. Change COMPILER=GNU to COMPILER=INTEL. Then run:
00029 
00030 ```
00031 make clean
00032 make
00033 ./demo 8
00034 ```
00035 
00036 This will report some information about the size of the system, perform rotations and verify that
00037 the state vector of probability amplitudes is still normalized. 
00038 
00039 OpenMP is enabled by default. To change the number of threads used by the program, set the value of OMP_NUM_THREADS before running the program, eg export OMP_NUM_THREADS=16. See examples/ompJob.sh for an example of how to do this in a job submission script.
00040 
00041 ## Building other examples
00042 
00043 There are other examples of codes using the QuEST library in the examples folder. To use one of these,
00044 copy from the examples folder into the root folder, eg:
00045 cp examples/timingDemo.c timingDemo.c
00046 
00047 Edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile. Change MY_FILE_NAME to the name of the file without
00048 any extension, eg MY_FILE_NAME=timingDemo 
00049 
00050 Change the name of the executable as desired eg EXE=myProg.
00051 
00052 Run with:
00053 ```
00054 make clean
00055 make
00056 ./myProg [NUMBER OF QUBITS] 
00057 ```
00058 To run on arcus-b on one node, use the job submission script examples/ompJob.sh
00059 
00060 ## Creating a new file from the template
00061 
00062 A basic example file is available in examples/basicTemplate.c. The structure of this file is:
00063 
00064 ```
00065 Initialisation
00066 Rotations
00067 Measurement
00068 2 Qubit phase gate
00069 Cleanup 
00070 ```
00071 
00072 In general, leave the initialization and cleanup sections and edit the rotations, measurement and phase gate
00073 sections. Further explanations are in the template file. The full list of QuEST library functions that can be used here is listed in qubits.h. 
00074 
00075 ## Multi node code
00076 
00077 To run over several nodes with MPI, edit the COMMON CONFIG section at the beginning of makefile. 
00078 
00079 Change USE_MPI=0 to USE_MPI=1.
00080 
00081 Run with:
00082 ```
00083 make clean
00084 make
00085 mpirun -np [NUMBER OF PROCESSES] ./demo [NUMBER OF QUBITS]
00086 ```
00087 To run on arcus-b, use the job submission script examples/mpiJob.sh
00088 
00089 Note that the API to the QuEST library is unchanged when running on multiple nodes. The template file basicTemplate.c
00090 is valid for both single and multi node environments. 
00091 
00092 ## API Documentation
00093 
00094 Full documentation is available at https://aniabrown.github.io/QuEST/
00095 
00096 The public API is [here](https://aniabrown.github.io/QuEST/qubits_8h.html)
00097
